item.title: [$] Long-duration stress-testing for filesystems
item.description:
Testing filesystems is a frequent topic at
the Linux Storage, Filesystem,
Memory Management, and BPF Summit (LSFMM+BPF); the 2025 edition was no
exception.  Boris Burkov led a filesystem-track session to discuss
stress-testing filesystems—and running those tests for lengthy periods.  He
reviewed what he has been doing when testing filesystems and wanted to
gather ideas for what could be done to catch more bugs before the
filesystems hit production.

item.title: Maximizing The Performance & Power Efficiency Of AMD Ryzen AI Max+ 395 With Platform Profiles
item.description: Last week I began posting Linux benchmarks of the flagship "Strix Halo" SoC, the AMD Ryzen AI Max+ PRO 395 with powerful Radeon 8060S graphics using the HP ZBook Ultra G1a laptop. Both the CPU and GPU results for the data published thus far have been mighty impressive and done at the Ubuntu Linux defaults... But the Ryzen AI Max+ 395 within the ZBook Ultra G1a can be pushed even further by leveraging the ACPI Platform Profiles capabilities. In this article is showing how much further performance -- and the power costs -- can be achieved out of this AMD Strix Halo SoC when leveraging the HP Power Profiles as well as the power efficiency for those wanting to run the SoC instead in the "power saver" / "low power" configuration.

item.title: Home Assistant deprecates the "core" and "supervised" installation modes
item.description:
Our recent article on Home Assistant observed that the project emphasizes installations using its own Linux distribution or within containers. The project has now made that emphasis rather stronger with this announcement of the deprecation of the "core" and "supervised" installation modes, which allowed Home Assistant to be installed as an ordinary application on a Linux system.

These are advanced installation methods, with only a small percentage of the community opting to use them. If you are using these methods, you can continue to do so (you can even continue to update your system), but in six months time, you will no longer be supported, which I'll explain the impacts of in the next section. References to these installation methods will be removed from our documentation after our next release (2025.6).

Support for 32-bit Arm and x86 architectures has also been deprecated.

item.title: Fedora Council overturns FESCo provenpackager decision
item.description:
The Fedora Council has ruled on the Fedora Engineering Steering Council's (FESCo) decision last year to revoke Peter Robinson's provenpackager status. In a statement published to the fedora-devel-announce mailing list, the council has announced that it has overturned FESCo's decision:

FESCo didn't have a specific policy for dealing with a request to remove Proven Packager rights. In addition, the FESCo process was handled entirely in private. The contributor didn't receive a formal notification or warning from FESCo, and felt blindsided by the official decision when and how it was announced. The Fedora Council would like to extend our sincerest apology on behalf of the Fedora Project to them.

LWN covered the story in December 2024.

item.description: Ubuntu 25.10 is joining the likes of Red Hat Enterprise Linux and SUSE Linux Enterprise that are using Chrony as their Network Time Protocol (NTP) implementation. Ubuntu 25.10 is switching over to Chrony in enabling Network Time Security (NTS) support on Ubuntu Linux...

item.title: Trump Dinner Funded by $150M Meme Coin Sparks ‘Orgy of Corruption’ Alarm
item.description:
Democratic senators and watchdogs have claimed the $150M Trump Dinner has offered the top buyers of a $TRUMP meme coin undisclosed entry to a private event at a Trump property. They have cited national-security risks, possible foreign funding and gaping ethics gaps in current stablecoin proposals.

The post Trump Dinner Funded by $150M Meme Coin Sparks ‘Orgy of Corruption’ Alarm appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Ethereum Rally Is Just Getting Started – Could a $10K Breakout Be Closer Than We Realize?
item.description:
Ethereum Price Prediction: ETH has gained 5% in 24 h to $2,655 and 63% in a month as volume has jumped 56%. The Pectra upgrade has expanded block capacity, burned fees and tilted supply negative. A bull-flag breakout could lift prices toward $3,600 if $2,850 fails to cap gains.

The post Ethereum Rally Is Just Getting Started – Could a $10K Breakout Be Closer Than We Realize? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: AI Agent COOKIE Price Soars 30% – MIND of Pepe Presale Ends in 9 Days, Next Crypto to Explode?
item.description:
Interest in AI-driven crypto has intensified. MIND of Pepe presale has raised $9.88 m and ends in nine days at $0.0037515, with an autonomous intelligence trading terminal in development, as peer token $COOKIE has added 30% in 24 h and 184% in a month amid Bitcoin highs.

The post AI Agent COOKIE Price Soars 30% – MIND of Pepe Presale Ends in 9 Days, Next Crypto to Explode? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: ‘Sell in May’ Got Wrecked – Bitcoin’s ATH Just Lit the Fuse on This Project’s BTC Milestone
item.description:
BTC Bull Token, a presale project that has raised $6.1 million, has linked milestone-based Bitcoin airdrops to the cryptocurrency’s new $111,544 record. Institutional ETF inflows of $4.28 billion this month and larger long-term holdings have supported the rally.

The post ‘Sell in May’ Got Wrecked – Bitcoin’s ATH Just Lit the Fuse on This Project’s BTC Milestone appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: BNB Chain Rockets to $686 as CZ Buzz Fuels Breakout Toward $800
item.description:
BNB Chain has overtaken Solana in market value, hitting $96 billion after a 13% monthly climb. Daily transactions have expanded six-fold as fees near $0.11, helped by DeFi demand, USD1 stablecoin inflows and CZ-linked attention. Analysts say clearing $720 could ignite a push toward $800.

The post BNB Chain Rockets to $686 as CZ Buzz Fuels Breakout Toward $800 appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act Returns to Exempt Wallets, Miners From Money-Transmitter Rules
item.description:
Congressmen Tom Emmer and Ritchie Torres have reintroduced the Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act, arguing that non-custodial crypto services—wallet developers, miners and validators—should not be labelled money transmitters, a stance backers believe will discourage firms from leaving the U.S.

The post Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act Returns to Exempt Wallets, Miners From Money-Transmitter Rules appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Kraken Debuts 50+ Tokenized U.S. Stocks for 24/7 Trading – Americans Excluded
item.description:
Kraken has moved beyond crypto by introducing more than 50 tokenized U.S. stocks and ETFs for non-U.S. traders. Issued on Solana and redeemable for cash linked to real shares, the ‘xStocks’ have shown how 24/7 settlement could reshape market hours and push regulators to clarify oversight.

The post Kraken Debuts 50+ Tokenized U.S. Stocks for 24/7 Trading – Americans Excluded appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: UK Judges Slam $11.9B Bitcoin SV Lawsuit – Proof of Losses Now Required
item.description:
UK judges have redrawn the Bitcoin SV Lawsuit, ruling damages must reflect market prices shortly after the 2019 exchange delistings. Claims tied to hypothetical future highs are struck out, leaving only early sellers and locked-out users to seek compensation for verifiable losses.

The post UK Judges Slam $11.9B Bitcoin SV Lawsuit – Proof of Losses Now Required appeared first on Cryptonews.
